Race.SpecificTitle: Mayor-President -- Metro Council, City of Baton Rouge
City Judge -- City Court, ES 2C, City of Baton Rouge
City Judge -- City Court, ES 2E, City of Baton Rouge
City Constable -- City Court, City of Baton Rouge
Constable -- Justice of the Peace Ward  3, District  2
PW Metro Council -- 1.23 Mills - MC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition 

Summary:  Renewal of the 1.23 mills property tax for a period of 10 years for the purpose of providing funds to purchase, maintain and operate machinery, facilities and equipment necessary in the eradication, abatement or control of mosquitoes and rodents, and maintaining adequate administrative and support staff in connection therewith.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 30 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to renew the levy and collection, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of a special tax of 1.23 mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the Parish (the "tax") (an estimated $4,180,000 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for the entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the tax collection for the year 2014, and annually thereafter to and including the year 2023, the proceeds of said tax to be used entirely and exclusively to provide funds to purchase, maintain and operate machinery, facilities and equipment necessary and useful in the eradication, abatement or control of mosquitoes, other arthropods of public health importance and rodents, title to which shall be in the public, and maintaining and providing for adequate administrative and support staff in connection therewith?

Race.SpecificTitle: EBR Parish School District -- Local Option - Term Limits
Race.SummaryText: East Baton Rouge Parish School District Proposition
Race.FullText:
"LOCAL OPTION ELECTION
Within East Baton Rouge Parish School District:
Shall the number of terms of office that any member of the school board may serve be limited to three consecutive four-year terms?"

Race.FullText:
"LOCAL OPTION ELECTION
Within City of Baker School District:

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Zachary -- Charter Amendment - CC
Race.SummaryText:
City of Zachary Proposition
(Charter Amendment)

Summary:  Amendment to Section 5.08 of the current home rule charter of the City of Zachary, State of Louisiana, as it pertains to Bonded Debt.
Race.FullText:
Shall Section 5.08 of the Home Rule Charter of the City of Zachary, State of Louisiana be amended to read as follows:
"Section 5.08 Bonded Debt.
The City is empowered to incur bonded debt and issue debt obligations only in the manner and under the conditions set forth in the laws of Louisiana?"

Race.SummaryText:
Broadmoor Crime Prevention & Improvement District Proposition

Summary:  Authorization for the Broadmoor Crime Prevention & Improvement District (the "District") to levy an annual fee on each improved parcel and unimproved parcel of land located within the boundaries of the District in the amount of One Hundred Dollars ($100.00) resulting in estimated annual proceeds of approximately $200,500.00, which fee shall be levied for a period of ten (10) years beginning on January 1, 2013, and ending on December 31, 2022, to be used to aid in crime prevention and enhance security of District residents by providing for an increase of law enforcement and security patrols within the District and to provide for the maintenance and improvement of areas within the District.
Race.FullText: Shall the Broadmoor Crime Prevention & Improvement District (the "District"), acting through the Board of Commissioners of the District, be authorized to levy and collect an annual fee on each improved parcel and unimproved parcel of land located within the boundaries of the District in the amount of One Hundred Dollars ($100.00) resulting in estimated annual proceeds of approximately $200,500.00, which fee shall be levied for a period of ten (10) years beginning on January 1, 2013, and ending on December 31, 2022, which fee shall be collected by any means authorized by law for the collection of taxes, all as provided in La. R.S. 33:9097.8, with the proceeds of said fee (after deducting the reasonable and necessary costs of collecting said fee) to be used to aid in crime prevention and enhanced security of District residents by providing for an increase of law enforcement and security patrols within the District and to provide for the maintenance and improvement of areas within the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: St. George FPD No. 2 -- 4 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 Proposition

Summary:  Renewal of four (4) mills property tax for a period of ten (10) years to provide for the development, operation and maintenance of the St. George Fire Protection District No. 2. (An estimated $4,000,000 is reasonably expected from the levy of this tax for the entire first year, and this amount will increase if the value of property subject to taxation increases.)
Race.FullText: Shall the St. George Fire Protection District No. 2, Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Section 19 of the 1974 Constitution of Louisiana, Part I of Chapter 7 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended (La. R.S. 40:1501), and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be reauthorized to levy and collect, and adopt a resolution providing for such levy and collection, of an ad valorem tax of four (4.0) mills (the "Tax") in each calendar year on all property subject to taxation in the St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge for a period of ten (10) years, commencing in the year 2014 to and including the year 2023, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax be used entirely and exclusively for development, operation and maintenance of the fire protection facilities of the St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 and paying the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, within St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge? (An estimated $4,000,000 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Tax for the entire first year, and this amount will increase if the value of property subject to taxation increases.)
